intro: Leleba, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the genus Saintpaulia and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Leleba is known for its ability to bloom continuously throughout the year under proper conditions.
